channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: From political heavyweight to being convicted in absentia: The fall of Sheikh Hasina
Does gravity make us age faster?
What next for Sheikh Hasina after death sentence in Bangladesh?
Why did Michelle Obama choose the white gown for first inauguration? Her new book gives us the answer
Inside Dhaka, where Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death
Is Apple looking to replace Tim Cook as CEO?
How ‘white-collar terrorism’ is not a new phenomenon
item.description: White-collar terrorism has long existed, particularly in Kashmir, but its evolving; highly educated networks now require a comprehensive and modern strategy to counter them

item.title: Preserving Buddhism in Bhutan amid Sinicisation of Tibet
item.description: India remains Bhutan’s friend and partner, supporting not just development and democracy, but also spiritual and cultural autonomy in the shadow of China’s assertive rise

item.title: Belem climate summit: Bridging North-South divide will be uphill task for Brazil
item.description: Brazil is leaving no stone unturned to make Cop30 remarkable, but it must unite the Global North and South to forge new cooperation against their common enemy—climate change

item.title: Before blaming Israel, Erdogan must face genocide charges himself
item.description: Turkish President Recep Erdoğan sees himself as exceptional and on a divine mission, he wants to be judge and jury but refuses to subordinate himself to the same standards

item.title: Terror’s urban avatar: How India can win the new proxy war
item.description: A plot stretching from Srinagar to Delhi reveals how terror has evolved; professionalised, networked, and aimed as much at social trust as at physical targets

item.title: Narnaul: A Haryana town lulled to sleep by its own history tales
item.description: Narnaul is a town where layers of forgotten history lie hidden in plain sight — from Sher Shah Sur’s grand legacy to Akbar’s mint and Rao Tula Ram’s rebellion — yet travellers pass it by, unaware of its remarkable past
